title: Peach Fur
text:
Peach Fur is an Australian rock band from the Gold Coast, whose members are most known for their live performances and blend of musical genres, including rock and roll, psych, punk, hip-hop, and reggae. They were formed in 2015 on the Gold Coast, Australia. The band members are Mikey Woodworth (Drums), Denny Hilder (Vocals, Guitar), Ben Crichton (Lead Guitar) and Liam Ward (Bass, Vocals). Their style is influenced by iconic bands and artists such as Pink Floyd, King Krule, Jurassic 5, and the Red Hot Chili Peppers.


== Career ==


=== 2015-2024: EPs and Earth Radio ===
Earth Radio (2023) is The debut studio album Earth Radio was released in 2023 following a series of Extended plays. The album includes a wide range of genres including jazz and disco. The concept behind Earth Radio imagines extraterrestrials sampling Earth's musical genres. The lead singles, Yummy and Sun Rays received positive reception. The album's release marked a significant milestone in Peach Fur's career.
In November 2024, the band announced their "indefinite hiatus" via social media.


=== Touring ===
Peach Fur has toured throughout Australia and Europe. They have performed at numerous festivals, including Spilt Milk.

=== Albums ===


=== EPs ===


== Awards ==
Peach Fur won the Live Act of the Year at the 2021 Gold Coast Music Awards. The band also won the Triple J Unearthed's Spilt Milk competition in 2022.
In November 2022, Peach Fur were featured as the Triple J Unearthed Featured Artist.
